title: Orecchiette with Broccoli Rabe
introduction: Orecchiette with Broccoli Rabe is a quintessential dish from Puglia, Italy. This recipe makes use of broccoli rabe, known for its slightly bitter taste that gets mellowed out when boiled. The flavors are balanced perfectly with garlic, anchovies, and a hint of red pepper, making it a delightful Italian classic that brings comfort and authenticity to your table.
ingredients: 1 bunch broccoli rabe (about 1/1⁄2 pounds), cut into 1-inch pieces
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the broccoli rabe and salt to taste. Cook the broccoli rabe for 5 minutes, then drain it. It should still be firm.

Dry the pot. Heat the oil with the garlic over medium-low heat. Add the anchovies and red pepper. When the garlic is golden, add the broccoli rabe. Cook, stirring well to coat the broccoli with the oil, until very tender, about 5 minutes.

Bring at least 4 quarts of water to a boil. Add the pasta and salt to taste. Stir well. Cook over high heat, stirring frequently, until the pasta is al dente, tender yet still firm to the bite. Drain the pasta, reserving some of the cooking water.
Add the pasta to the broccoli rabe. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until the pasta is well blended. Add a little of the cooking water if necessary.

variations.description: Eliminate the anchovies. Serve the pasta sprinkled with chopped toasted almonds or grated Pecorino Romano.
Eliminate the anchovies. Remove the casings from 2 Italian sausages. Chop the meat and cook it with the garlic, hot pepper, and broccoli rabe. Serve sprinkled with Pecorino Romano.
